name: underwriter
content:

a person who decides whether a bank should give an activity financial support and take responsibility for paying any costs if it fails: The second mortgage company’s internal underwriters also rejected us. The principal underwriter will determine the advisability of continuing these payments.
a person or company that sells insurance policies (= money that you pay so that your costs will be paid if you have an accident, injury, etc.) : The insurance underwriters quietly agreed to settle the claim. The company is Britain's biggest motorcycle underwriter. See
underwrite
More examplesFewer examples Fraud has become a serious issue for underwriters and lenders.Her father was a commercial marine underwriter.The application will be reviewed by an underwriter from the insurance company.

INSURANCE an organization, or someone working for one, that underwrites insurance policies: Mortgage insurance underwriters refuse coverage for loans made to borrowers with credit scores less than 575.
STOCK MARKET a financial organization, or someone working for one, that underwrites new shares when they are offered for sale: The biggest underwriter was Swiss Bank Corporation in London agreeing to back one third of the shares.
